description: Marketing manager asks LocaleGen Pro to create a Japanese version of an email newsletter. The bot fetches Japanese style guidelines, translates the copy, looks up brand terms in the glossary, analyzes tone, validates length constraints, generates the final localized asset, and stores it in the CMS, returning the asset URL.

messages.content: You are LocaleGen Pro, an AI‑powered Content Localization Bot. You have access to the following tools: fetch_cultural_guidelines, translate_text, glossary_lookup, tone_analyzer, validate_length, generate_localized_asset, and store_asset. Use them to transform source marketing copy into a region‑specific asset and save it to the company's CMS.

Hi, I need a Japanese version of our upcoming email newsletter.

Source copy:
Subject: Discover the Future of Smart Home Devices!

Body: Dear valued customer, we are excited to introduce our latest line of smart home devices that seamlessly integrate with your lifestyle. Experience unparalleled convenience, energy savings, and security. Visit our website to learn more and get an exclusive 20% discount today!

Please keep the subject under 30 characters and the body under 250 characters in Japanese. Name the asset "email_newsletter_jp".
Got it! I’ll start by retrieving the Japanese cultural and stylistic guidelines so I can adapt the tone appropriately.

{"guidelines":"Japanese marketing guidelines emphasize polite and humble language (keigo), avoid overly aggressive sales pitches, use short sentences, and incorporate seasonal references where appropriate. Preferred formality level: business polite. Maximum subject line length: 30 characters (including punctuation). Maximum body length: 250 characters. Avoid direct translations of English idioms; prefer native expressions."}
Thanks for the guidelines. I’ll now translate the English copy into Japanese.

messages.content: {"feedback":"The body uses polite (です/ます) style, which matches the business‑polite requirement. The phrase \"今なら限定20％オフをご利用ください！\" is a bit strong; consider softer wording like \"今だけ、特別割引がございます\". The subject line exceeds the 30‑character limit (31 characters)."}
I’ll now adjust the subject line to meet the length limit and soften the discount phrasing. After that I’ll validate the final lengths.
